intro: Machaerina juncea, commonly known as the silver fern, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-white undersides on its leaves, which give it a striking appearance. The plant belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. It typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Machaerina juncea is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is also culturally significant to the Māori people.
